pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw: It looks like you're running a version of yt without Andrew's patch applied. Let me know if you need help with the mercurial commands necessary to pull in Andrew's PR locally.
content.html: It looks like you're running a version of yt without Andrew's patch applied. Let me know if you need help with the mercurial commands necessary to pull in Andrew's PR locally.

pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw:
I think line 148 should be something else with the patch applied. The incantation for getting this into your local yt is: 

1. Make sure yt is activated
2. cd $YT_DEST/src/yt-hg/ 
3. hg pull -r fa856f1 https://bitbucket.org/atmyers/yt
4. hg update -C fa856f1
5. python setup.py develop

The "-C" option to hg update will wipe any uncommited changes in your working copy, so be wary.
content.html:
I think line 148 should be something else with the patch applied. The incantation for getting this into your local yt is:

  1. Make sure yt is activated
  2. cd $YT_DEST/src/yt-hg/
  3. hg pull -r fa856f1 https://bitbucket.org/atmyers/yt
  4. hg update -C fa856f1
  5. python setup.py develop

The "-C" option to hg update will wipe any uncommited changes in your working copy, so be wary.

pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw:
I'm evidently using that incorrectly, because I still get `yt.utilities.exceptions.YTFieldNotFound: Could not find field '('gas', 'temperature')' in ParticleData.`
I tried doing this:
```
ds.add_deposited_particle_field(('all', 'particle_temperature'), 'cic')
ds.add_field(('gas', 'temperature'), lambda x,y: y[('deposit', 'all_cic_temperature')], units='K')
```
content.html:
I'm evidently using that incorrectly, because I still get yt.utilities.exceptions.YTFieldNotFound: Could not find field '('gas', 'temperature')' in ParticleData. I tried doing this:

ds.add_deposited_particle_field(('all', 'particle_temperature'), 'cic')
ds.add_field(('gas', 'temperature'), lambda x,y: y[('deposit', 'all_cic_temperature')], units='K')

pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw:
Ah ok, is the radmc exporter expecting the dataset to have a `('gas', 'temperature')` field? Maybe that could be pluggable?

I'm a little surprised that the way you've defined the alias there doesn't work. I'll take a look at that later if I have some time....
content.html:
Ah ok, is the radmc exporter expecting the dataset to have a ('gas', 'temperature') field? Maybe that could be pluggable?

I'm a little surprised that the way you've defined the alias there doesn't work. I'll take a look at that later if I have some time....

pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw:
I'm afraid I don't know too much about setting up SPH fields. But, the radmc3d exporter doesn't need it to be called ('gas', 'temperature') - you should be able to do 


```
#!python

writer.write_dust_file(('deposit', 'all_cic_temperature'), "dust_temperature.dat")
```

directly. Another option would be to specify the positions of the sources and have radmc-3d compute the dust temperature for you, as described [here](http://yt-project.org/docs/3.2/analyzing/analysis_modules/radmc3d_export.html#continuum-emission).
content.html:
I'm afraid I don't know too much about setting up SPH fields. But, the radmc3d exporter doesn't need it to be called ('gas', 'temperature') - you should be able to do 

writer.write_dust_file(('deposit', 'all_cic_temperature'), "dust_temperature.dat")

directly. Another option would be to specify the positions of the sources and have radmc-3d compute the dust temperature for you, as described here.

pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw:
Good point, that's what I was doing anyway.  If I skip the temperature writing part, other things work, but then I hit an exception here:
```
velocity_fields = ["velocity_x", "velocity_y", "velocity_z"]
writer.write_line_file(velocity_fields, "gas_velocity.inp")
```
Traceback:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "radmc_jim.py", line 55, in <module>
    writer.write_line_file(velocity_fields, "gas_velocity.inp")
  File "/Users/adam/repos/yt/yt/analysis_modules/radmc3d_export/RadMC3DInterface.py", line 234, in write_line_file
    data = ad[field]
  File "/Users/adam/repos/yt/yt/data_objects/data_containers.py", line 246, in __getitem__
    f = self._determine_fields([key])[0]
  File "/Users/adam/repos/yt/yt/data_objects/data_containers.py", line 555, in _determine_fields
    finfo = self.ds._get_field_info("unknown", fname)
  File "/Users/adam/repos/yt/yt/data_objects/static_output.py", line 515, in _get_field_info
    if field in self.field_info:
  File "/Users/adam/repos/yt/yt/fields/field_info_container.py", line 298, in __contains__
    if dict.__contains__(self, key): return True
TypeError: unhashable type: 'list'
```

This worked previously on a grid sim, so perhaps this is a legit bug?

content.raw:
It looks like the sph frontends don't have ('all', 'velocity_x'), and so on. What happens if you use:

```
#!python

velocity_fields = [("gas", "velocity_x"), ("gas", "velocity_y"), ("gas", "velocity_z")]
```
content.html:
It looks like the sph frontends don't have ('all', 'velocity_x'), and so on. What happens if you use:

velocity_fields = [("gas", "velocity_x"), ("gas", "velocity_y"), ("gas", "velocity_z")]

pullrequest.title: [WIP] Adding support for Octree-style output files in the RadMC-3D exporter

content.raw:
Looks like that worked.  At least the crash in my code has moved outside of yt.  I can't yet confirm whether the resulting files work with radmc3d, but we're past the simple crashing stage.

EDIT: actually, I see this error from radmc3d: ` ERROR while reading grid: base grid is not regularly cubically spaced.`
content.html:
Looks like that worked. At least the crash in my code has moved outside of yt. I can't yet confirm whether the resulting files work with radmc3d, but we're past the simple crashing stage.

EDIT: actually, I see this error from radmc3d: ERROR while reading grid: base grid is not regularly cubically spaced.

description: This adds the ability to use the radmc-3d exporter with SPH datasets. It needs to be tested better before it's ready to be included.
